question: Which Union Ministry of India launched a portal named "Integrated Government Online training" (iGOT) for capacity building of frontline workers fighting COVID-19 pandemic?
option2: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
option4: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
explanation:
Union Ministry of Human Resource Development has launched an online portal named \'Integrated Government Online Training Portal\' for frontline workers fighting coronavirus outbreak.
This training module has been launched in the DIKSHA platform of the HRD Ministry for capacity building of frontline workers including doctors, nurses, hygiene workers, State Government officers, police organisations and other volunteers to efficiently handle the COVID-19 pandemic.
